Package myAdapter

Class ListAdapter.Iterator

  • java.lang.Object
    • myAdapter.ListAdapter.Iterator
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    HIterator
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ListAdapter.ListIterator
    Enclosing class:
    ListAdapter
    private class ListAdapter.Iterator
extends java.lang.Object
implements HIterator

    An iterator over a collection. Iterator takes the place of Enumeration in the Java collections framework. Iterators differ from enumerations in two ways:

    1) Iterators allow the caller to remove elements from the underlying collection during the iteration with well-defined semantics.

    2) Method names have been improved.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      protected int index
      Int variable that store the current position of the iterator.
      protected boolean next
      Boolean variable used to move forward on the list.
      protected java.util.Vector vec
      Vector to iterate on.

    • Method Detail

      • hasNext

        public boolean hasNext()
        Returns true if the iteration has more elements. (In other words, returns true if next would return an element rather than throwing an exception.)
        Specified by:
        hasNext in interface HIterator
        Returns:
        true if the iterator has more elements.

      • next

        public java.lang.Object next()
        Returns the next element in the iteration.
        Specified by:
        next in interface HIterator
        Returns:
        the next element in the iteration.
        Throws:
        myLib.NoSuchElementException - iteration has no more elements.

      • remove

        public void remove()
        Removes from the underlying collection the last element returned by the iterator. This method can be called only once per call to next. The behavior of an iterator is unspecified if the underlying collection is modified while the iteration is in progress in any way other than by calling this method.
        Specified by:
        remove in interface HIterator
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the next method has not yet been called, or the remove method has already been called after the last call to the next method.
